cycloneMessage.issuingUnit: NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL
cycloneMessage.systemGeoRefPt1: ABOUT 90 MI...145 KM N OF SOCORRO ISLAND
cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP2 ALL TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM
BULLETIN Tropical Storm Jova Advisory Number 3 NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL EP122017 900 AM MDT Sat Aug 12 2017
...DISORGANIZED JOVA PASSING JUST NORTH OF SOCORRO ISLAND...
SUMMARY OF 900 AM MDT...1500 UTC...INFORMATION ---------------------------------------------- LOCATION...20.1N 111.2W ABOUT 90 MI...145 KM N OF SOCORRO ISLAND MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...40 MPH...65 KM/H PRESENT MOVEMENT...WNW OR 295 DEGREES AT 13 MPH...20 KM/H MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1003 MB...29.62 INCHES
WATCHES AND WARNINGS -------------------- There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK ------------------------------ At 900 AM MDT (1500 UTC), the center of Tropical Storm Jova was located near latitude 20.1 North, longitude 111.2 West. Jova is moving toward the west-northwest near 13 mph (20 km/h). A turn toward the west is expected later today, and the tropical storm should continue moving westward through early next week.
Maximum sustained winds are near 40 mph (65 km/h) with higher gusts. Gradual weakening is forecast during the next 48 h, and Jova is forecast to become a remnant low on Monday.
Tropical-storm-force winds extend outward up to 45 miles (75 km) from the center.
The estimated minimum central pressure is 1003 mb (29.62 inches).
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND ---------------------- None
NEXT ADVISORY ------------- Next complete advisory at 300 PM MDT.
$$ Forecaster Zelinsky
NNNN
